alert.note: Alert for Benton; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 6:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Benton, Camden, Hickory, Maries, Miller, Morgan and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In west central Missouri, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM CDT, Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Maries River at County Road 211, Saline Creek at Square Line Road, Rainy Creek at Knobby Road, Dry Fork at County Road 407 and Deer Creek at Highway V. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eldon, Osage Beach, Warsaw, Village of Four Seasons, Lake Ozark, Belle, Laurie and Iberia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
